answers.feedback: Correct!. These events are not mutually exclusive! Damage can be caused by many things other than a typhoon. Alternatively, a typhon can occur but might not cause damage. Both situations imply that within the sample space the area of $A$ and $B$ overlap (typhoon and damage occurs) but there is also a region within the area for both events that does not overlap (typhoon without damage, or damage without typhoon).
